title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Red, yellow and purple colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted to cardboard
inscribed:
Recto: in graphite along top edge of paper on mount: "1/12" and bracket indicating repeat; In graphite at left: bracket and "repeat"; in graphite at right on mount: "satin" and "rep" each with indicators to the design; in graphite lower center of mount along edge of drawing: [arrow] and "warp"; in graphite upper right corner: 1
Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 3; in graphite at right: 3 3/8 in 13 1/2
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Pattern of alternating horizontal lines and vertical lines arranged in bands of red, yellow and purple each with a graphite band of short parallel strokes between.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. Red, yellow and purple colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted to cardboard. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-449.
